required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Skin Self-examination Education Delivered During the Mammography Experience.

brief_summary.textblock: The skin self-examination for melanoma (SSE) educational materials were developed with the input provided by women undergoing screening mammograms. The investigators seek to evaluate the performance of SSE by women and find out if women seek care with a dermatologist for a concerning mole or for a melanoma screening examination by a dermatologist after reviewing the materials received during the mammogram visit. The purpose of this study is to enhance the early detection of melanoma among women who are engaging in health promotion by having mammograms. The investigators specifically aim to evaluate the performance of SSE by women, who receive information during their mammogram appointment, and then follow-up with dermatology for a melanoma screening examination.

detailed_description.textblock: The proposed study is the second phase of a project assessing the feasibility and effectiveness of enhancing the early detection of melanomas among women, who are engaging in health promotion by having mammograms. The initial phase of the project framed risk messages, developed posters and brochures with the input provided by women undergoing screening mammograms, and assessed the feasibility of delivering the program during the mammogram visit at the Lynn Sage Comprehensive Breast Center of Northwestern Medicine/ Prentice Women's Hospital. The investigators seek to evaluate performance of skin self-examination (SSE) by women, who receive information during their mammogram appointment, and follow-up with dermatology for a melanoma screening examination. In the second phase, a more intensive intervention in which women will not only receive information about SSE, but will also receive a reminder to perform SSE one week after the screening mammogram and information on how to schedule an appointment with dermatology will be provided. The number of women who perform SSE at home and find a concerning mole (lesion), number who see a dermatologist, and number who have a concerning lesion biopsied will be compared in two arms of the study 1) women who receive the intensive intervention 2) women who receive the informational brochure about SSE alone. The hypothesis is that women who receive more the intensive educational intervention will be more likely to perform SSE at home and schedule a follow-up dermatologist appointment as compared to those who receive the information brochure alone. This project builds upon Robinson's successful SSE training program for melanoma patients that resulted in patients' accurate evaluations of suspicious lesions relative to dermatologists' skin examinations.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants That Performed a Skin Self-Examination at 3-months
primary_outcome.description: The percentage of participants that performed skin self-examination at the 3-month time interval.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Number of Melanomas Determined by Dermatologist Review of Concerning Lesion
secondary_outcome.description: The total number of melanomas identified by a dermatologist in women who found a concerning mole

arm_group.description: Participants receive brochure, card advising how to make an appointment with dermatology, and reminder in one week to perform SSE.
Participants receive brochure, card advising how to make an appointment with dermatology, and reminder in one week to perform SSE.

intervention.description: Women view an educational poster in changing room, and they receive a brochure.
Women view an educational poster in changing room, and they receive a brochure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women 18 years of age or older
- Waiting to have a mammogram
Exclusion Criteria:
- Male

eligibility.gender_description: Women waiting to have a mammogram

facility.name: Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine Department of Dermatology

results_reference.citation: Rzepecki AK, Jain N, Ali Y, Chavez L, Choi J, Schlosser B, Liko-Hazizi E, Friedewald SM, Robinson JK. Promoting early detection of melanoma during the mammography experience. Int J Womens Dermatol. 2017 Jul 5;3(4):195-200. doi: 10.1016/j.ijwd.2017.06.002. eCollection 2017 Dec.

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Intensive Intervention
group.description: Participants receive brochure, card advising how to make an appointment with dermatology, and reminder by telephone, text message or email in one week to perform SSE. Intensive Intervention: Women view an educational poster in changing room, and they receive a brochure.

group.title: Minimal Intervention
group.description: Participants receive brochure, card advising how to make an appointment with dermatology. Minimal Intervention: Women view an educational poster in changing room, and they receive a brochure.

baseline.population: Women having a screening mammogram who were educated in performing skin self-examination completed a baseline self-report of prior skin self-examination

group.title: Intensive Intervention
group.description: Participants receive brochure, card advising how to make an appointment with dermatology, and reminder by telephone, text message or email in one week to perform SSE. Intensive Intervention: Women view an educational poster in changing room, and they receive a brochure.

group.title: Minimal Intervention
group.description: Participants receive brochure, card advising how to make an appointment with dermatology. Minimal Intervention: Women view an educational poster in changing room, and they receive a brochure.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Number of Participants That Performed a Skin Self-Examination at 3-months
outcome.description: The percentage of participants that performed skin self-examination at the 3-month time interval.
outcome.population: Women performing skin self-examination as reported 3 months after the intervention

group.title: Intensive Intervention
group.description: Women who received an educational brochure and a 1-week reminder call or email to complete SSE

group.title: Educational Intervention
group.description: Women who only received a brochure.

measure.title: Number of Participants That Performed a Skin Self-Examination at 3-months
measure.description: The percentage of participants that performed skin self-examination at the 3-month time interval.
measure.population: Women performing skin self-examination as reported 3 months after the intervention

analysis.groups_desc: change from baseline to 3 months in performance of skin self-examination Parallel: response rate
analysis.p_value_desc: P-value of <0.05 is the threshold for statistical significance. The hypothesis was that more women randomized to the intensive intervention would perform skin self-examination.
analysis.method_desc: Chi-Squared is equal to 1.58, with a P-Value of 0.12.

outcome.title: Total Number of Melanomas Determined by Dermatologist Review of Concerning Lesion
outcome.description: The total number of melanomas identified by a dermatologist in women who found a concerning mole
outcome.population: Women who found a concerning mole at month 1 and month 3 and proceeded to have a skin examination by a dermatologist

group.title: Intensive Intervention
group.description: Participants receive brochure, card advising how to make an appointment with dermatology, and reminder in one week to perform SSE. Intensive Intervention: Women view an educational poster in changing room, and they receive a brochure.

measure.description: The total number of melanomas identified by a dermatologist in women who found a concerning mole
measure.population: Women who found a concerning mole at month 1 and month 3 and proceeded to have a skin examination by a dermatologist

analysis.groups_desc: results of skin clinical examination and biopsy of clinically suspicious moles
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Types of lesions in the following categories: Benign nevus, seborrheic keratosis, lentigo, dermatofibroma, atypical nevus. melanoma

group.description: Participants receive brochure, card advising how to make an appointment with dermatology, and reminder in one week by telephone call, text message or email to perform SSE. Intensive Intervention: Women view an educational poster in changing room, and they receive a brochure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Limitations of our study include a relatively short duration of follow-up resulting in a modest number of incident invasive melanoma cases and a lack of participant blinding of allocation to intervention arms.
